diff_hunk:
@@ -23,13 +23,8 @@ function bazel_clean_and_fetch() {
   # TODO(pcloudy): Re-enable it after bazel clean --expunge is fixed.
   if ! is_windows; then
     bazel clean --expunge
-    # TODO(https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/2220) Remove the nested `bazel query`.
-    bazel fetch $(bazel query "//tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/examples/android/...")
-  else
-    # TODO(pcloudy): Also filter out //tensorflow/examples/android/... on Windows after
-    # https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/2248 is fixed.
-    bazel fetch //tensorflow/...
   fi
+  bazel fetch "//tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/examples/android/..."
body: @aj-michael Since you are the author of https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/0b9ebfee8d7f3bd5cf68f4dba4790bf3fed9349d, can you comment on this? Should we exclude `//tensorflow/examples/android/...` or not? What I observed is that `bazel fetch //tensorflow/...` is fine with bazel 0.4.3, but failing with Bazel@HEAD
body_html: @aj-michael Since you are the author of bazelbuild/bazel@0b9ebfe, can you comment on this? Should we exclude //tensorflow/examples/android/... or not? What I observed is that bazel fetch //tensorflow/... is fine with bazel 0.4.3, but failing with Bazel@HEAD
body_text: @aj-michael Since you are the author of bazelbuild/bazel@0b9ebfe, can you comment on this? Should we exclude //tensorflow/examples/android/... or not? What I observed is that bazel fetch //tensorflow/... is fine with bazel 0.4.3, but failing with Bazel@HEAD
